Rita,
 
Mike is rapidly becoming a very respected researcher and developer=
 in the field of box research and any advice or opinions he may have 
also =
any devices he designs are worthy of serious consideration. he is a researc=
her to be taken seriously and his advice is a valuable asset to any new res=
earcher.
 
Bruce

Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team 


To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.comFrom: michaelcoletta@...: Wed, 12 Dec 2007 15:1=
5:45 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: RS 12-469 Questions on How to Use




Hi R=
ita,Welcome to the group. Yes, Bruce is correct... my sound chamber design =
is an experiment to see how well that design works. I took the basic compon=
ents of a typical ghost box system and placed them into the plastic enclosu=
re. But to hear what is desired does not always require a chamber. The cham=
ber is just a place where the three sound components can mix and be capture=
d by the microphone.Just one of many different methods that can be used.I h=
ave even got good results by just using a 12-470 and a recorder in the open=
 air.I did build a couple of new chamber systems and will probably build on=
e more for a total of 4. And I'll probably provide some of those to some lo=
cals here to test. I'd like to get others input on this experimental design=
. LC is also putting one together using the 12-469. So we will have data fr=
om that area too.Again... welcome to the group.- Mike--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > Hi Rita,>=
 > And welcome to the group I am always pleased to see new members and new =
interest in our research.> > You do not need anything extra to use the 12-4=
69 you can use it with just the ear buds that are supplied with the radio.>=
 If you like you can purchase an inexspensive fold up speaker from radio sh=
ack. It is 19.99 and works quite well.> > go to this page for a pic and des=
cription of the speaker http://www.radioshack.com/product/index.jsp?product=
Id=3D2103838&cp=3D&sr=3D1&origkw=3Dfolding+speaker&kw=3Dfolding+speaker&par=
entPage=3Dsearch> > The sound chamber that mike colleta has been developing=
 is an experiment he is doing and is in no way necessary to> obtain good sp=
irit communication with the RS box.> > Please feel free to e-mail me with a=
ny questions you have, I will be glad to help. paranormalinvestigating@...>=
 > Bruce> > Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team > > > To: EVP-ITC@=
...: lcdupla@...: Wed, 12 Dec 2007 03:53:51 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: RS =
12-469 Questions on How to Use> > > > > Rita, I think you will have to get =
a pair of amplified speakers on that 469, and put them in a sound chamber o=
f some sort. In that chamber, you will want probably an amplified microphon=
e running into your voice recorder, to pick up the sounds bouncing around i=
n there. You can also add some white noise into the box, but I think people=
 are getting results without adding the additional noise. The chamber seems=
 to really bounce the sound around and give you a good mix to record.LC--- =
In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Rita" <nvrenuf1031@> wrote:>> Hi Everyone,> > =
New to group here. We just completed the advance hack on our 469 > model. A=
re you supposed to hear the voices from the radio stations or > just white =
noise?> > Also, is it best to hook up an external speaker, one or two, in o=
rder > to record to a digital recorder? What is the best way to record, usi=
ng > digital recorder, or direct into PC using Sound recorder, and using a =
> line in/line out connection?> > What is the recommended length of session=
s. Should I try just a minute > or two, or longer at one sitting?> > Thanks=
 to all!> Rita> > > > > > > > _____________________________________________=
_____________> Get the power of Windows + Web with the new Windows Live.> h=
ttp://www.windowslive.com?ocid=3DTXT_TAGHM_Wave2_powerofwindows_122007>
